playmovies

PURPOSE

[4D] shows R videos simultaneously as a movie.

SYNOPSIS

function playmovies( I, fps, loop )

DESCRIPTION 

 [4D] shows R videos simultaneously as a movie.

 Plays a movie.

 USAGE
  playmovies( I, [fps], [loop] )

 INPUTS
  I       - MxNxTxR or MxNx1xTxR or MxNx3xTxR array (if MxNxT calls
            playmovie)
  fps     - [100] maximum number of frames to display per second use
            fps==0 to introduce no pause and have the movie play as
            fast as possible
  loop    - [0] number of time to loop video (may be inf),
            if neg plays video forward then backward then forward etc.

 OUTPUTS

 EXAMPLE
  load( 'images.mat' );
  playmovies( videos );

 See also MONTAGES, PLAYMOVIE, MAKEMOVIES

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

0035 if( nargin<2 || isempty(fps)); fps = 100; end

0037 
0038 playmovie( I, fps, loop )
0039 
0040 %
0041 % nd=ndims(I); siz=size(I); nframes=siz(end-1);
0042 % if( nd==3 ); playmovie( I, fps, loop ); return; end
0043 % if( iscell(I) ); error('cell arrays not supported.'); end
0044 % if( ~(nd==4 || (nd==5 && any(size(I,3)==[1 3]))) )
0045 %   error('unsupported dimension of I'); end
0046 % inds={':'}; inds=inds(:,ones(1,nd-2));
0047 % clim = [min(I(:)),max(I(:))];
0048 %
0049 % h=gcf; colormap gray; figure(h); % bring to focus
0050 % for nplayed = 1 : abs(loop)
0051 %   if( loop<0 && mod(nplayed,2)==1 )
0052 %     order = nframes:-1:1;
0053 %   else
0054 %     order = 1:nframes;
0055 %   end
0056 %   for i=order
0057 %     tic; try disc=get(h); catch return; end %#ok<NASGU>
0058 %     montage2(squeeze(I(inds{:},i,:)),1,[],clim);
0059 %     title(sprintf('frame %d of %d',i,nframes));
0060 %     if(fps>0); pause(1/fps - toc); else pause(eps); end
0061 %   end
0062 % end
